standards.name: General Transit Feed Specification (GTFS)
standards.description: The most widely used open data standard for sharing fixed-route transit schedules, stops, and fare information with the public and trip planning apps. GTFS extensions cover real-time updates (GTFS-RT), pathways, fares, flexible services, and operational data.

standards.name: GTFS-Realtime (GTFS-RT)
standards.description: Extension of GTFS that provides real-time updates including vehicle positions, trip updates, and service alerts.

standards.name: GTFS-Flex
standards.description: An extension of GTFS designed to support flexible and demand-responsive transit services, such as paratransit and microtransit, enabling agencies to communicate non-fixed route service details.

standards.name: Service Interface for Real Time Information (SIRI)
standards.description: A modular standard for real-time information exchange, covering vehicle locations, schedules, and service messages between control centers, agencies, and public-facing systems.

standards.name: Transit Communications Interface Profiles (TCIP)
standards.description: A comprehensive standard for data exchange among transit business systems, subsystems, and devices, including scheduling, passenger information, incident management, and fare collection.

standards.name: Mobility Data Specification (MDS)
standards.description: Facilitates secure communication of trip, vehicle, and service data between mobility providers (e.g., microtransit, scooters) and city agencies, supporting regulatory and operational needs.

standards.name: Transactional Data Specification (TDS)
standards.description: Focuses on structuring scheduling and booking data for demand-responsive transit (DRT) and paratransit services, enabling interoperability for trip requests, confirmations, and status updates.

standards.name: Transport Operator to Mobility as a Service Provider (TOMP) API
standards.description: An open standard for technical communication between transport operators and Mobility as a Service (MaaS) providers, supporting integrated trip planning, booking, and payment.

standards.name: Transit Operational Data Standard (TODS)
standards.description: Extends GTFS to include operational details such as deadhead time and other behind-the-scenes data useful for transit operators.

standards.name: Transit ITS Data Exchange Specification (TIDES)
standards.description: Standardizes access to archived and historical ITS data, including vehicle location, passenger counts, and fare transactions, supporting analysis and reporting.

standards.name: Curb Data Specification (CDS)
standards.description: Communicates curb-use regulations and management data between cities and mobility providers to enable better curb access and policy enforcement.

standards.name: CurbLR
standards.description: A lightweight curb regulation format designed to work with CDS and open data tools, enabling digital curb rule publishing and use by cities and third parties.
